Test Name: HPV Low-Risk Typing by In Situ Hybridization
Specimen Type: Formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded cervical tissue or alcohol-fixed cytology slides
Purpose: To detect and identify low-risk Human Papillomavirus (e.g., HPV 6 and 11) in clinical specimens.
Container: 10% neutral buffered formalin container/paraffin block or alcohol-fixed slide
Equipment: In situ hybridization oven/incubator, brightfield or fluorescence microscope, ventilation hood
